intro: Amphoradenium gaudichaudii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions as a decorative plant.
